alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 03 at 2:50AM AKST until January 03 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occuring. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will difficult. Blowing snow will cause whiteout conditions. Large snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 50 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
